Description: Pot. Handles in form of cheetahs and spouts in form of deer heads. Stylised vetetal motifs in green, blue and red. Two thin red bands at top of jug. Fritware (stonepaste); painted in white, turquoise and blue glaze with overglaze in red.
Bibliographic references: Hobson 1932b / A Guide to the Islamic Pottery of the Near East (fig.53)
Lane 1947 / Early Islamic Pottery: Mesopotamia, Egypt and Persia (fig.70.A)
Akbarnia et al 2018 / The Islamic World: a History in Objects (p.104-105, fig.4)
